info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 1:02PM EDT until July 23 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Union County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 200 PM EDT. * At 101 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles northwest of Monroe, or near Wesley Chapel, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Monroe, Indian Trail, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate, Lake Park, Hemby Bridge, Stallings, Weddington and Marshville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding of urban areas and other locations with poor drainage. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
